posts.name: avraham
posts.cooked:
I have a Pololu Digital Distance Sensor 25cm and it is connected to pwm and not to dio how do I connect to it via wpilib and Java?

With simple digital input it doesn’t work

Thanks!

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked: These sensors are digital output and work for my team on our roboRIO DIO (DigitalInput). If you still need help, then we need to see your code and picture of your wiring and connections.  Did you remove the protective liner over the sensor as the instructions say? There is an indicator light on it so you don’t even need code to tell if it’s sensing or not.

posts.name: avraham
SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked:
This is the correct code (presented as a Supplier but that isn’t necessary):

This is a proximity sensor returning a true/false based on an object within 25 cm of it or not.

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked: If the red light is on, then it is detecting an object within 25 cm. It goes off when the object is moved out of range. What do you mean by it doesn’t work? Post the complete code that you say doesn’t work.

posts.name: Adam Fleming
posts.cooked: Could you show how it is plugged into the RoboRio?

posts.custom_user_title: FRC 3596 Lead Mentor/Alum, FTC 30607 Lead Mentor

posts.name: Omer Huly
posts.cooked:
tcrvo:

it is connected to pwm and not to dio

According to NI roboRIO 2.0 Embedded Controller for FRC User Manual , PWM ports are output only so you can’t read a sensor through them. When you applied @SLAB-Mr.Thomas ’s solution, did you connect the sensor to DIO port 0 (as written in the code)?

link_counts.title: NI roboRIO 2.0 Embedded Controller for FRC User Manual - NI

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked:
Omer_Huly:

did you connect the sensor to DIO port 0

AdamF:

Could you show how it is plugged into the RoboRio?

That’s 3 times including my plea for a picture. And if it isn’t a wiring problem my next guess, if OP says the trouble is the red light never goes off, is to try the sensor without the case in case the sensor sees its case.
